body.p: On returning from an excursion in the cou^n^try Monday the 30, of July, my husband placed ^a^ letter in my hands from Rev Royse, giving an account of your ill health and embarrasing circumstances, need I say that I felt sorrowful? The past came rushing to my mind, those days in which affluence was yours!! but alas, prosperity has taken wings, and you are thrown upon a cold and selfish world, but thank God there are persons possessing the true spirit of christianity -- x x x x x --

You have met with friends Heaven bless them -- -- Oh! how my heart throbs for the
the ability to assist you, but just at present we are considerably pressed for means -- this has been a hard year to live -- but as Mr Lakey has stated we can offer you a home for a time -- and should consider it the greatest pleasure to contribute to your comfort and happiness.

You will let us know what your conclusions are -- -- From the way your friend addressed us I concluded that you did not wish to be recognized, that is the reason my name was not mentioned in the letter Mr Lakey wrote --

Write us immediately
I am unable to write more -- wish the note to go in the morning --
Believe me as ever your truly affectionate sist
If you are unable to travel we will try and assist you where you are. We wish much to see you.
